subject: p11016935
History: Year old man with chest pain, Please evaluate for thoracic pathology.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest provided. Patient is status post CABG with median sternotomy and aortic valve replacement. Moderate-to-severe emphysema with apical predominance. 7 mm nodular opacity in the right upper lobe has not changed. Heart is top-normal in size. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Vertebroplasty changes are seen in the mid-thoracic spine.
